alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Morris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 3:56PM CDT until March 31 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN...NORTHERN MORRIS AND CENTRAL TITUS COUNTIES... At 355 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Cookville, or 7 miles northeast of Mount Pleasant, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Mount Pleasant, Mount Vernon, Naples, Omaha, Us 259 And I 30 Intersection, Cookville, Winfield, Miller`s Cove, Hopewell and Monticello. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for northeastern Texas. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for northeastern Texas. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
